marks:
Ebizo_ wa
yajusha wo yame te
shimau to ka
wagam Shunko_ sahitsu (pianted with left hand)
text:
This painting depicts the famous Kabuki actor Ichikawa Danju_ro_ V in the play "Shibaraku." According to the story, a corrupt warlord and his henchmen terrify innocent people within a shine precinct. The hero, played by Danju_ro_, enters the scene via the hanamichi, a raised runway leading to the stage. In a fierce voice he shouts "Shibaraku!" or "Wait a moment!" causing the thugs to turn on him. The ensuing fight, with its swashbuckling bravura, is a favorite among Kabuki enthusiasts. Danju_ro_, made superhuman by his righteous fury, annihilates ten criminals with a single stroke of his sword. His dramatic costume and coiffure, and unusually long sword, are all meant to convey his extraordinary strength and vehemence. This painting of Danju_ro_ V bears a poetic inscription by the actor himself, written when he was fifty-seven years old. The poem is written from the viewpoint of a fellow actor, referring to Danju_ro_ by his stage name of Ebizo_:

Ebizo_ has given up being an actor;

Being a performer myself,

I regret it happened

to such a good actor as he.
title: Ichikawa Danjūrō V as Kagekiyo
